physical_factors.men_preference: Shorter than self (82% prefer -2 to -6 inches)
physical_factors.key_finding: Height preferences are more rigid in online dating than in-person contexts
physical_factors.practical_tip: Focus on posture, confidence, and overall presentation over actual height measurements

physical_factors.key_finding: Waist-to-hip ratio (0.7 for women) and shoulder-to-waist ratio (1.6 for men) are universally attractive
physical_factors.practical_tip: Regular exercise improves both actual fitness and perceived health signals

physical_factors.key_finding: Facial symmetry signals genetic health and developmental stability
physical_factors.practical_tip: Good grooming, skincare, and confident expressions enhance perceived symmetry

physical_factors.research: Walster et al., 1966; Albada et al., 2002
physical_factors.key_finding: Personal style serves as a signal of self-care and social awareness
physical_factors.practical_tip: Invest in well-fitting clothes, maintain hygiene, develop personal style

physical_factors.research: Mehu et al., 2007; Mason et al., 2005
physical_factors.key_finding: Duchenne smiles (reaching the eyes) are universally attractive across cultures
physical_factors.practical_tip: Practice genuine smiling and maintaining 60-70% eye contact during conversations

behavioral_factors.how_to_demonstrate: Maintain eye contact, speak clearly, make decisions, own your space without dominating

behavioral_factors.gender_difference: Women value humor production more; men value humor appreciation
behavioral_factors.how_to_demonstrate: Use self-deprecating humor, find shared laughter, avoid offensive jokes

behavioral_factors.gender_difference: Slightly more valued by women (9.2 vs 8.6)
behavioral_factors.how_to_demonstrate: Active listening, empathy, emotional regulation, reading social cues

behavioral_factors.gender_difference: More valued by women in long-term partners
behavioral_factors.how_to_demonstrate: Discuss goals, show passion for work/hobbies, demonstrate growth mindset

behavioral_factors.gender_difference: Universally valued, slightly higher by women (9.4 vs 9.0)
behavioral_factors.how_to_demonstrate: Small acts of consideration, treat service workers well, show compassion
Engage in meaningful conversation, show curiosity, avoid condescension
Be genuine about interests, admit mistakes, share real thoughts respectfully

interaction_patterns.description: Subtly matching body language and speech patterns
Asking follow-up questions, remembering details, showing engagement
Light-hearted, non-offensive teasing that creates rapport

key_insights.description: One positive trait (e.g., physical attractiveness) can positively influence perception of other traits
key_insights.implication: First impressions matterâ€”invest in overall presentation

key_insights.description: Repeated exposure increases attraction and liking
key_insights.implication: Regular, positive interactions build attraction over time

key_insights.description: People are attracted to those who show interest in them
key_insights.implication: Express genuine interest, but avoid over-pursuit

key_insights.description: We're drawn to people with similar values, interests, and backgrounds
key_insights.implication: Find and emphasize common ground early
